# updown_status_page (Resource)

`updown_status_page` defines a status page

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "updown_check" "web" {
  url = "https://example.com"
}

resource "updown_check" "api" {
  url = "https://api.example.com"
}

resource "updown_status_page" "main" {
  name        = "My Status Page"
  description = "Current status of our services"
  visibility  = "public"

  checks = [
    updown_check.web.id,
    updown_check.api.id,
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `checks` (List of String) Ordered list of check tokens to display on the status page.

### Optional

- `name` (String) Name of the status page.
- `description` (String) Description of the status page.
- `visibility` (String) Visibility of the status page (public, protected, or private). Defaults to `"public"`.
- `access_key` (String, Sensitive) Access key for protected status pages. Auto-generated by the API.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID (token) of this resource.
- `url` (String) Public URL of the status page.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# You can find the corresponding tokens by looking at the following API endpoint:
# curl -s https://updown.io/api/status_pages\?api-key\=<your_api_key>
# [{"token":"abcd","url":"https://updown.io/p/abcd","name":"My Status Page",...}]

terraform import updown_status_page.main abcd
```
